comments.body: Can we download this file? Maybe a clever `build.sh`/`bld.bat`? I am fine bundling the source, but that is unusual.
I am not sure how to make a recipe that would download this file as part of the recipe process since I'm also bundling a short setup.py file too that isn't available in `vasole/pymca`
Maybe you can download with `curl` and copy the file directly into site-packages to avoid adding the setup.py and the file itself. Not sure how healthy that is though...
That seems much more complicated than including the one python file

I would not say much more, but it is more :wink: 

The real question is: do we want sources bundled in the recipe? I am OK with lightweight cases like this, but I don't think we want that becoming common practice.

My Linux distro does mandate that we bundle the source together with the specfile and that leads to all sorts of trouble with people altering the source code directly and not documenting it properly.

@ericdill is this the same case as `spefile` and `pyespec`?

That is a new precedent for packaging. It would be better if you add some info (maybe the description field?) explaining the "subset fork."
